intro: Iridorkis jenkinsiana, commonly known as the Jenkins' iridorkis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera. The plant is characterized by its striking, iris-like flowers that bloom in shades of blue and violet. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
